edu.cornell.georeference

Class Georeference

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cornell.georeference.Georeference

  • public class Georeference
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows the user to query through their indices to find desired places.
    Author:
    Yang Yang Zheng

    • Constructor Detail

      • Georeference

        public Georeference(org.apache.lucene.store.Directory modernIndex,
            org.apache.lucene.store.Directory histIndex,
            java.lang.String locSplitString,
            java.lang.String latLngSplitString,
            int hitsPerPage,
            double defaultRange)
        Create a georeference object by specifying the indices and a bunch of details
        Parameters:
        modernIndex - the index/directory that stores the modern day places
        histIndex - the index/directory that stores the historical places
        locSplitString - the string that is used to separate points in bound and near points
        latLngSplitString - the string that is used to separate different attributes of a point in bound and near points
        hitsPerPage - the max number of results from a search
        defaultRange - the default range/distance (in miles) from the specified point before the result got excluded (if there are multiple near points, the result is only excluded if it is not in the ranges for all of the near points).

      • Georeference

        public Georeference(org.apache.lucene.store.Directory modernIndex,
            org.apache.lucene.store.Directory histIndex)
        Create a georeference object by specifying the indices and use default values for other fields.
        Parameters:
        modernIndex - the index/directory that stores the modern day places
        histIndex - the index/directory that stores the historical places

      • searchLocation

        public java.lang.String searchLocation(java.lang.String placeName,
                              java.lang.String bound,
                              java.lang.String nearPoints,
                              int searchOption,
                              int distanceScoreOption)
                                throws org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException,
                                       java.io.IOException,
                                       org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method can search through the indices to find the latitude-longitude coordinate of the place you are looking for by returning a list of possible matching results.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        bound - a boundary box that filters out places outside of the box (default format: 0,0;1,1)
        nearPoints - points and their ranges (in miles) so that they can affect the score (default format(0,0,100;1,1,1000;...); if the ranges are not specified, the method will use the default range value
        searchOption - controls with index to search on
        distanceScoreOption - how distances from the near points affect the score
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that match the search; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException

      • searchLocation

        public java.lang.String searchLocation(java.lang.String placeName,
                              java.lang.String bound,
                              java.lang.String nearPoints)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method can search through the indices to find the latitude-longitude coordinate of the place you are looking for by returning a list of possible matching results. It uses the default searchOption BOTH and the default distanceScoreOption SQUARE_ROOT.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        bound - a boundary box that filters out places outside of the box (default format: 0,0;1,1)
        nearPoints - points and their ranges (in miles) so that they can affect the score (default format(0,0,100;1,1,1000;...); if the ranges are not specified, the method will use the default range value
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that match the search; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException

      • searchLocation

        public java.lang.String searchLocation(java.lang.String placeName,
                              java.lang.String bound,
                              java.lang.String nearPoints,
                              int searchOption)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method can search through the indices to find the latitude-longitude coordinate of the place you are looking for by returning a list of possible matching results. It uses the default distanceScoreOption SQUARE_ROOT.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        bound - a boundary box that filters out places outside of the box (default format: 0,0;1,1)
        nearPoints - points and their ranges (in miles) so that they can affect the score (default format(0,0,100;1,1,1000;...); if the ranges are not specified, the method will use the default range value
        searchOption - controls with index to search on
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that match the search; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException

      • searchNearbyPlaces

        public java.lang.String searchNearbyPlaces(java.lang.String placeName,
                                  double latitude,
                                  double longitude,
                                  double rangeInMiles,
                                  boolean inclusive,
                                  int searchOption,
                                  int distanceScoreOption)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method finds a list of nearby places to the specified place. The score depends on the distance of the result from the specified place.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        latitude - the latitude of the place you want to search for
        longitude - the longitude of the place you want to search for
        rangeInMiles - only return results in the specified range (in miles)
        inclusive - whether or not to include the specified place in the result list
        searchOption - controls with index to search on
        distanceScoreOption - how the distance from the specified place to the result affects the score
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that are in the range; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException

      • searchNearbyPlaces

        public java.lang.String searchNearbyPlaces(java.lang.String placeName,
                                  java.lang.String pointInfo,
                                  boolean inclusive,
                                  int searchOption,
                                  int distanceScoreOption)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method finds a list of nearby places to the specified place. The score depends on the distance of the result from the specified place.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        pointInfo - the latitude and longitude of the specified place and the range/distance (in miles) you want your results to be in (default format: 0,0,100)
        inclusive - whether or not to include the specified place in the result list
        searchOption - controls with index to search on
        distanceScoreOption - how the distance from the specified place to the result affects the score
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that are in the range; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException

      • searchNearbyPlaces

        public java.lang.String searchNearbyPlaces(java.lang.String placeName,
                                  java.lang.String pointInfo)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method finds a list of nearby places to the specified place. The score depends on the distance of the result from the specified place. It uses the default searchOption BOTH and the default distanceScoreOption SQUARE_ROOT. It is also set to not include the specified place in the results.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        pointInfo - the latitude and longitude of the specified place and the range/distance (in miles) you want your results to be in (default format: 0,0,100)
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that are in the range; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException

      • searchNearbyPlaces

        public java.lang.String searchNearbyPlaces(java.lang.String placeName,
                                  java.lang.String pointInfo,
                                  int searchOption)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method finds a list of nearby places to the specified place. The score depends on the distance of the result from the specified place. It uses the default distanceScoreOption SQUARE_ROOT. It is also set to not include the specified place in the results.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        pointInfo - the latitude and longitude of the specified place and the range/distance (in miles) you want your results to be in (default format: 0,0,100)
        searchOption - controls with index to search on
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that are in the range; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException

      • searchNearbyPlaces

        public java.lang.String searchNearbyPlaces(java.lang.String placeName,
                                  double latitude,
                                  double longitude,
                                  double rangeInMiles)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
        This method finds a list of nearby places to the specified place. The score depends on the distance of the result from the specified place. It uses the default searchOption BOTH and the default distanceScoreOption SQUARE_ROOT. It is also set to not include the specified place in the results.
        Parameters:
        placeName - the name of the place you want to search for
        latitude - the latitude of the place you want to search for
        longitude - the longitude of the place you want to search for
        rangeInMiles - only return results in the specified range (in miles)
        Returns:
        a string in xml format that lists out all places (name and their latitude and longitude) that are in the range; each search result is scored; the search result list is sorted by their score
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException
